Jenna from Transition Initiative Rockland is excited to announce a workshop on Open Space Technology. You may remember this style of meeting facilitation that is mentioned in The Transition Handbook; it is also it's own book. Check it out here:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wi​ki/Open_Space_Technology

On Octobe r 8th from 10:00 a.m. to 4:00pm(ish) Lisa Fernandes of Portland Permaculture and the Resilience Hub will provide an interactive training for us. This training is geared towards folks actively involved in the Transition Town movement and Permaculture but is now open to all.  We can accommodate a maximum of 25 people and the cost for the day is $45. Participants are asked to bring their own lunch.  Please feel free to forward this email to others in your initiating and work groups.

To register for this event mail your check for $45 to: 

Jenna Labbe
168 W. Meadow Rd.
Rockland, ME. 04841
(You can RSVP here but must send in your check to confirm your spot)

Below is more information on the specifics of this workshop and a link to Lisa Fernandes' bio. I hope to see you there!
Peace,
Jenna

Lisa Fernandes of Portland Maine Permaculture and The Resilience Hub is pleased to offer a one-day program to build capacity in the area of convening Open Space Events (and Facilitation in general), with a focus on the needs of Transition Initiatives and Permaculture Groups in Maine and the northeast region.

Topics Covered:
Open Space Rationale & Intro to Methodology
Designing a Good Open Space Event
Goals Articulation
Event Preparation Options or “Creating the Vessel”
The Nuts and Bolts of Open Space
Event Follow-up or “Wakes & Eddies”
Special Considerations for Transition & Permaculture Communities
Mini Practice Sessions
Attributes/Skills of Effective Facilitators/Convenors: Traditional vs. Open Space
“Live” Open Space Practicum with Invited Guests

Learning Outcomes :

  • Attendees will become versed in the fundamental philosophies and methods behind Open Space events.
  • They will be comfortable designing and convening an open space event.
  • They will have the tools and confidence to facilitate and convene Open Space, quasi-open-space and “traditional” meetings and have a solid sense of when one or another of these will best suit the needs.
  • Attendees will enjoy and celebrate the gaining of new skills which can be immediately put to work in their resilience-building actvities.

Facilitator Bio:   http://about.me/lisa.m.fernandes
